Diamond::

She looked at the horde of fiendish looking bots. She smiled. This 
looked like a crew that she could get along with. She looked up at 
Killfest and smiled, showing her fangs slightly. "This is the only 
pod that I could get. And it's a long walk back so I suggest that we 
get as many of you inside. I will come back for those who can't fit 
on this trip." She looked Killfest up and down. She liked him. He 
appealed to her reptile side. "Hold on a nano second."

She walked into the pod and dumped the crates that were in the cargo 
hold of the pod. She walked back out and looked at Killfest. "I have 
made a little more room in here. Get you and those who can fit inside 
and I'll have to come back for the rest."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Killfest/Scyther/EndBringer/Demise/Greven::
> 
> Killfest turns his head as he sees Diamond land, walking over to 
her 
> and watching DrillBit arrive as well. His team follows behind, all 
of 
> them except for Scyther easily over four feet taller than the two 
> Predacons. Scyther was only seven feet, but looked as deadly as the 
> rest of them.
> 
> Killfest walked up to Diamond, looking down at her like she was 
> fairly inferior. The terrorist leader was mostly red, a black 
stripe 
> running around his waist and black spots on his torso. Horns grew 
out 
> from the sides of his head, angling forward. Behind him stood the 
two 
> bots that dwarfed even him: EndBringer and Demise, and to the side 
of 
> those the two other members of his team.
> 
> EndBringer stood about two feet taller than Killfest, snarling down 
> at the Predacons. His body was black and purple, four tentacles 
> reaching out from his back, slowly moving through the air. 
> EndBringer's arms were crossed at his chest.
> 
> Demise, in his only form, looking like a giant croutched-over 
beast, 
> stood on all fours, resembling a gorrila that had been magnified by 
> quite alot and then roasted. His body was a charred red color, his 
> giant front claws touching the floor at the knuckles. His knees 
bent 
> forward, he looked more like a beast than a bot, only a little bit 
> shorter than EndBringer, but he was crouched.
> 
> Greven, standing to the left of Demise, was almost as tall as 
> Killfest, looking like a normal bot on steroids, his body varying 
> shades of gray. Ok EndBringer's side was Scyther, in one of his 
> almost-unlimited supply or robot modes.
> 
> "I don't think your pod will fit my crew," Killfest says, glancing 
at 
> the pod behind Diamond.
>
